intro: Tephroseris tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tephroseris tenuifolia is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh climatic conditions.
